_header: When the clot clingeth and the cuckoo singeth
_description: A young man’s fancies in spring: schoolboy’s exercise — five monorhyming lines with Latin translation

BLHar1002.Transcription:
When the clot klynguethand þe cucko synguth& þe
                    brome sprynguththen his tyme a ȝongelyngfor to go a
                    wowyng
BLHar1002.Editions:
Wright,  Cyril Ernest. 
             “Late Middle English Parerga in a School Collection.” 
             Review of English Studies
         n.s. 2 (1951): 114-20: 119.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Mirth in Manuscripts.” 
             Essays and Studies by Members of the English Association
         n. s. 21 (1968): 1-28: 26.
